ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Referral source: Friend or relative
Referral source: Study staff
Referral source: Referral from health care provider
Referral source: Newspaper or magazine
Referral source: brochure
Referral source: Poster or flier
Referral source: Mailing
Referral source: website
Referral source: Radio
Referral source: Television
Referral source: other referral source
Referral source: specify
Have you consumed at least one alcoholic beverage in the past 5 years?
In the past 6 months, how many drinks containing alcohol have you consumed on average during a week?
Have you consumed 6 or more alcoholic beverages on one or more occasions in the last 6 months?
Are you willing to not drink for about 6 years OR to drink an alcoholic beverage a day for about 6 years?
(WOMEN ONLY) Are you post-menopausal (at least 12 months without menstruation)?
Are you currently participating in another intervention study?
Do you have plans to move out of the area in the next 2 years?
Do you have reliable transportation to the clinic?
